meanings.definition: To cover or protect the top of something with a cap.
meanings.sent1: She was becapping the bottle to keep it fresh.
meanings.sent2: The worker was becapping the pen after use.
meanings.sent3: The chef was becapping the pot like a magician.
meanings.sent4: The clouds were becapping the mountain peaks.
meanings.sent5: The mother bird was becapping her eggs with care.

meanings.definition: To put a cap on something.
meanings.sent1: He was becapping the toothpaste tube tightly.
meanings.sent2: The child was becapping the markers after coloring.
meanings.sent3: The student was becapping the pen as if sealing a secret.
meanings.sent4: The darkness was becapping the city as night fell.
meanings.sent5: The gardener was becapping the flowers to protect them from frost.

meanings.sent3: The joke was becapping the laughter in the room.
